intro: Pseudotrachydium pauciradiatum, commonly known as the narrow-rayed starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped inflorescence composed of small white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Pseudotrachydium pauciradiatum is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
